name: Empty but not vain
description:
« Without fixation, thoughts are freed by themselves - like the wind, People of Tingri, which never clings to any object. »

 The wind blows through the sky and flies across continents without ever settling anywhere. It sweeps through space leaving no trace whatsoever. Let thoughts pass through your mind in the same way, leaving no karmic residue and never altering your realization of innate simplicity. 

Hundred Verses of Advice of Padampa Sangye (commented by Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche)

Laisser tomber les pétales, comme les épines, 
ne retenir que l'amour.
